ЁЯСС
Vasudeva Kanva

Reign: c. 73тАУ64 BCE
Founder of the dynasty. He was the 'Amatya' (Minister) of Devabhuti, the last Shunga king. According to 'Harshacharita', he had the king murdered using assassins disguised as a maid and seized the throne. The Puranas describe his reign as just.

ЁЯЫбя╕П
Successors: Bhumimitra and Narayana

After Vasudeva, his son Bhumimitra (c. 64тАУ50 BCE) and grandson Narayana (c. 50тАУ38 BCE) ruled. Some coins bearing the name of Bhumimitra have been found in the Panchala region (modern Western Uttar Pradesh), indicating his influence extended somewhat beyond Magadha.

ЁЯУЙ
Susharman: The Last Ruler

Reign: c. 38тАУ28 BCE
Susharman was the fourth and last king of this dynasty. According to the Puranas, he was defeated and killed by the 'Andhra Bhс╣Ыtya' (Satavahana king Simuka or Pulomaavi). With his defeat, the glorious era of Magadha came to a temporary end.
